intro: Homalium nudiflorum var. ciliolatum, commonly known as the smooth-flowered huito, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in forest ecosystems.
